column1: Little Goat Diner////service was slightly slow and spotty
column2: but it was opening day. we got a reuben that was good but a bit watery/drippy
column3: mashed potatoes w/ beef gravy which were awesome
column4: and some mac and cheese which was a tad bland. for dessert we got fried fluffernutter which is actually a PB&J deconstruction thing. pretty good if you're ok with slightly heavy desserts. they comped us dessert due to the spotty service (which was actually ok
column5: compared to some other experiences) so that was nice. everything is a la carte
column6: so the sandwich didn't come with fries or anything. all told it'd probably be $20 for a sammich and fries. kinda on the high end.
